parameters.definition: Units of coffee powder required to make one mocha
Units of milk required to make one mocha
Units of coffee powder required to make one regular coffee
Units of milk required to make one regular coffee
Total available units of coffee powder
Time required to make one mocha
Time required to make one regular coffee
Minimum ratio of the number of mochas to the number of regular coffees

description: A coffee shop sells mochas and regular coffees. Each mocha requires \param{CoffeePowderPerMocha} units of coffee powder and \param{MilkPerMocha} units of milk. Each regular coffee requires \param{CoffeePowderPerRegular} units of coffee powder and \param{MilkPerRegular} units of milk. The shop has available \param{TotalCoffeePowder} units of coffee powder and \param{TotalMilk} units of milk. Making a mocha takes \param{TimePerMocha} minutes and making a regular coffee takes \param{TimePerRegular} minutes. Since mochas are more popular among people, the shop must make at least \param{MochaToRegularRatio} times as many mochas as regular coffees. How many of each should they make to minimize the total production time?
